column3: Hey there, friend. Is there something I can do for you?
We received word that Valigarmanda's been set free. If there's something you wished to ask, I suggest we keep it brief.
Have you heard the news? The fell beast Valigarmanda was slain! And for a mercy, there were no casualties to speak of.
The rite of succession is over, and not one, but <Emphasis>two</Emphasis> Dawnservants have taken the throne by the sounds of it. I can but wonder what the future holds for Tural.
Welcome, welcome! Any friend of the Dawnservants is a friend of ours. How can I help you?
What kind of place is this?

I was a merchant peddling wares, once upon a time, but I hurt my back carrying one too many boxes that were just a <Emphasis>little</Emphasis> too heavy. Now I mostly serve as a guide to travelers passing through.
We Pelupelu endeavor to make every trade an amicable one, and spread happiness through our business. You would be hard-pressed to find anyone dissatisfied after dealing with us.
Of course, with the threat of Valigarmanda looming, business has proven quite difficult of late.
Merchants and mercenaries often stop here at Icuvlo's Inn to lay their heads before traveling elsewhere.
I always recommend they spend a day at Panaqpelu Retreat. The hot springs do wonders for my back. If you plan to stay at the inn, you simply must try it.
I would understand if you didn't, of course. With Valigarmanda free, this is no time to be relaxing.
